page.title: 03CHANGES ON THE FARM.
page.content: E.E.C. milk quotas introduced since last April have meant a 10% cut in this farmer's herd. He used to have 220 dairy cattle.In the last few years a computer has been used to record details of each cow's milk yield. In the next few years the farmer fears even less milk will be needed as the public demand less animal fat in their diet. He wonders if there is a way to use our milk products to feed starving people in other countries. But he asks "Who will pay?". He feels too there is not likely to be the same encouragement from the government to the dairy farmer because of the present surplus of milk products in Europe.
